trans-unit.source: Get started with data on Android (JavaScript backend) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with data on Android (JavaScript backend) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to get started using Mobile Services to leverage data in your Android app (JavaScript backend).
trans-unit.target: Learn how to get started using Mobile Services to leverage data in your Android app (JavaScript backend).

trans-unit.source: Add Mobile Services to an existing Android app (JavaScript backend)
trans-unit.target: Add Mobile Services to an existing Android app (JavaScript backend)

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to add persistent data to an Android app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to add persistent data to an Android app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will download an app that stores data in memory, create a new mobile service, integrate the app with the mobile service so that it stores and updates data in Azure Mobile Services instead of locally, and then use the Azure classic portal to view changes to data that were made by running the app.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will download an app that stores data in memory, create a new mobile service, integrate the app with the mobile service so that it stores and updates data in Azure Mobile Services instead of locally, and then use the Azure classic portal to view changes to data that were made by running the app.

trans-unit.source: watch the tutorial
trans-unit.target: watch the tutorial

trans-unit.source: Play Video
trans-unit.target: Play Video

trans-unit.source: This tutorial helps you understand in more detail how Azure Mobile Services can store and retrieve data from an Android app.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial helps you understand in more detail how Azure Mobile Services can store and retrieve data from an Android app.

trans-unit.source: So it walks you through many of the steps that are already completed for you in the Mobile Services quickstart tutorial.
trans-unit.target: So it walks you through many of the steps that are already completed for you in the Mobile Services quickstart tutorial.

trans-unit.source: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, consider first completing the tutorial
trans-unit.target: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, consider first completing the tutorial

trans-unit.source: Get started with Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Get started with Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see Azure Free Trial.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Azure Free Trial.

trans-unit.source: the [Azure Mobile Services Android SDK];
trans-unit.target: the [Azure Mobile Services Android SDK];

trans-unit.source: the Android Studio integrated development environment, which includes the Android SDK; and Android 4.2 or a later version.
trans-unit.target: the Android Studio integrated development environment, which includes the Android SDK; and Android 4.2 or a later version.

trans-unit.source: The downloaded GetStartedWithData project requires Android 4.2 or a later version.
trans-unit.target: The downloaded GetStartedWithData project requires Android 4.2 or a later version.

trans-unit.source: However, the Mobile Services SDK requires only Android 2.2 or a later version.
trans-unit.target: However, the Mobile Services SDK requires only Android 2.2 or a later version.

trans-unit.source: Sample Code
trans-unit.target: Sample Code

trans-unit.source: To see the completed source code, go
trans-unit.target: To see the completed source code, go

trans-unit.source: here
trans-unit.target: here

trans-unit.source: Download the GetStartedWithData project
trans-unit.target: Download the GetStartedWithData project

trans-unit.source: Get the sample code
trans-unit.target: Get the sample code

trans-unit.source: Inspect and run the sample code
trans-unit.target: Inspect and run the sample code

trans-unit.source: Create a new mobile service in the Azure classic portal
trans-unit.target: Create a new mobile service in the Azure classic portal

trans-unit.source: Add a new table to the mobile service
trans-unit.target: Add a new table to the mobile service

trans-unit.source: Update the app to use the mobile service for data access
trans-unit.target: Update the app to use the mobile service for data access

trans-unit.source: Test the app against your new mobile service
trans-unit.target: Test the app against your new mobile service

trans-unit.source: Now that the app has been updated to use Mobile Services for back end storage, you can test it against Mobile Services, using either the Android emulator or an Android phone.
trans-unit.target: Now that the app has been updated to use Mobile Services for back end storage, you can test it against Mobile Services, using either the Android emulator or an Android phone.

trans-unit.source: From the **Run** menu, click **Run app** to start the project.
trans-unit.target: From the **Run** menu, click **Run app** to start the project.

trans-unit.source: This executes your app, built with the Android SDK, that uses the client library to send a query that returns items from your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This executes your app, built with the Android SDK, that uses the client library to send a query that returns items from your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: As before, type meaningful text, then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: As before, type meaningful text, then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: This sends a new item as an insert to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This sends a new item as an insert to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure classic portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure classic portal], click **Mobile Services**, and then click your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Data** tab, then click **Browse**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Data** tab, then click **Browse**.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the **TodoItem** table now contains data, with some values generated by Mobile Services, and that columns have been automatically added to the table to match the TodoItem class in the app.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the **TodoItem** table now contains data, with some values generated by Mobile Services, and that columns have been automatically added to the table to match the TodoItem class in the app.

trans-unit.source: This concludes the **Get started with data** tutorial for Android.
trans-unit.target: This concludes the **Get started with data** tutorial for Android.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: Verify Android SDK Version
trans-unit.target: Verify Android SDK Version

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling an Android app to work with data in Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling an Android app to work with data in Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Next, consider completing one of the following tutorials that is based on the GetStartedWithData app that you created in this tutorial:
trans-unit.target: Next, consider completing one of the following tutorials that is based on the GetStartedWithData app that you created in this tutorial:

trans-unit.source:
[Validate and modify data with scripts]
Learn more about using server scripts in Mobile Services to validate and change data sent from your app.
trans-unit.target:
[Validate and modify data with scripts]
Learn more about using server scripts in Mobile Services to validate and change data sent from your app.

trans-unit.source:
[Refine queries with paging]
Learn how to use paging in queries to control the amount of data handled in a single request.
trans-unit.target:
[Refine queries with paging]
Learn how to use paging in queries to control the amount of data handled in a single request.

trans-unit.source: Once you have completed the data series, try these other Android tutorials:
trans-unit.target: Once you have completed the data series, try these other Android tutorials:

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with authentication]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with authentication]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app.

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with push notifications]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app with Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with push notifications]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app with Mobile Services.
